pros: Amazing place to work, small environment

review_title: Advocate for yourself or you will never get equal pay
job_title: Associate Campus Minister in Wichita, KS
pros: Vacation time Staff is wonderful to work with Students are amazing
cons: Pay is low Little to no raises Benefits regularly got cut I found out I was not paid the same as my male colleague who had the same position, education, and experience as I did. I asked for a raise multiple times, It wasn't until I said I knew his pay that they gave me a raise. It was a direct violation of equal pay.

pros: Most of the people are awesome and positive. It can be a great place to work with a team environment in some areas.
cons: The pay is low for anyone below the VP level. It's often us versus them within the University. The VP and above leadership are out of touch with the staff. They don't know how to properly support and encourage the staff. Some VP's are never in the office.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Wichita, KS
pros: Great for students and easy work
As a student having an on-campus job that worked with my class and athletics schedule was necessary. The flexible hours and wonderful leadership made this job a great experience.
cons: Depending on what department your work for your supervision can create a negative working experience by demanding too much and paying too little. Most of the on-campus work is great but some are not so much. The pay is the biggest con because most people make minimum wage while trying to pay for a school that costs 30K+ a year.

job_title: Graduate and Professional Recruiter in Wichita, KS
pros: 4 weeks of vacation and nice plan package(dental and Health Insurance)
cons: Bad leaders, no communication between department.

pros: The people I work directly with are great and the pace isn't hectic. Pay isn't terrible compared to some places.
cons: Administration at higher levels don't provide the support to staff that they need. They are more focused on getting students in (regardless of qualifications or the best interests of the student) to get their tuition money. Raises aren't prioritized, no room to grow. Some attitudes in the institution are also getting more exclusionary in regards to religion despite having "Inclusion" in their stated values.

review_title: They want it to be a family atmosphere...
pros: summer and school hours synched up with public schools
cons: poor pay; entitled culture attitude; not progressive enough

pros: As an adjunct teacher you are treated well and given the chance to develop your teaching skills.  The students and staff are show respect and are easy to work with.  Overall it's a great collegiate environment.
cons: Don't let yourself be led on by the prospect of anything else that you are hired on to do.  You may be given the same class load a tenured professor, but your adjunct status will not turn into anything else.

pros: Nice people, work with your schedule, not micro-managed, treat you like an adult, very organized!
cons: The only con is that the Adjunct pay never increases. It stays at a fixed rate. Only con I noticed. Everything else was great!

review_title: Friends has grown on me as time has passed
pros: The base pay is fairly competitive for my position and the people I work with are great.
cons: The job description for my position was not entirely what I expected. I'm seeking out deeper fulfillment in the work and the campus environment.

pros: Tuition paid for if you are full time.
cons: low salary, a lot of turn over

pros: Administration is supportive.  They care about their students.
cons: No cons to speak of really.  Sometimes it seems too small.

review_title: You would think that a University would be more organized
pros:

cons:

pros: Students that are in programs in their career field.
